summary: In 2012, Sebastian Vettel became a three-time Formula One World Champion with Red Bull Racing. Fernando Alonso finished second, three points behind, and Kimi Räikkönen came in third. The season had 20 races, the most ever, and started in Australia in March and ended in Brazil in November. It also saw the return of the United States Grand Prix. Seven different drivers won the first seven races, a new record. Vettel won his third consecutive championship, joining only two others in history to do so. Michael Schumacher, a seven-time world champion, retired after the season.
title: 2012 Formula One World Championship
